au.edu.federation.caliko

Class FabrikChain2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.FabrikChain2D

  • public class FabrikChain2D
extends Object
    Class to represent a 2D Inverse Kinematics (IK) chain that can be solved for a given target using the FABRIK algorithm.
    Version:
    0.9.9 - 29/12/2015
    Author:
    Al Lansley

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FabrikChain2D.BaseboneConstraintType2D
      Basebone constraint types.
      static class  FabrikChain2D.BoneConnectionPoint2D
      Bones may be connected together at either the start or end of the 'host' bone being connected to.

    • Method Detail

      • addBone

        public void addBone(FabrikBone2D bone)
        Add a bone to the end of this IK chain of this FabrikChain2D object.

        This chain's mChainLength property is updated to take into account the length of the new bone added to the chain.

        In addition, if the bone being added is the very first bone, then this chain's mBaseLocation property is set from the start joint location of the bone.

        Parameters:
        bone - The FabrikBone2D object to add to this FabrikChain2D.
        See Also:
        mChainLength, mBaseLocation

      • addConsecutiveConstrainedBone

        public void addConsecutiveConstrainedBone(Vec2f directionUV,
                                          float length,
                                          float clockwiseDegs,
                                          float anticlockwiseDegs)
        Add a constrained bone to the end of this IK chain.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a base bone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is called on a chain which does not contain a base bone then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Specifying a direction unit vector of zero will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone
        length - The length of the new bone
        clockwiseDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        anticlockwiseDegs - The anti-clockwise constraint angle in degrees.

      • addConsecutiveConstrainedBone

        public void addConsecutiveConstrainedBone(Vec2f directionUV,
                                          float length,
                                          float clockwiseDegs,
                                          float anticlockwiseDegs,
                                          Colour4f colour)
        Add a constrained bone to the end of this IK chain.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a base bone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is called on a chain which does not contain a base bone then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Specifying a direction unit vector of zero will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone
        length - The length of the new bone
        clockwiseDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        anticlockwiseDegs - The anti-clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        colour - The colour to draw the bone.

      • addConsecutiveBone

        public void addConsecutiveBone(Vec2f directionUV,
                               float length)
        Add a unconstrained bone to the end of this IK chain.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a base bone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is called on a chain which does not contain a base bone then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Specifying a direction unit vector of zero will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone
        length - The length of the new bone

      • getBaseboneConstraintType

        public FabrikChain2D.BaseboneConstraintType2D getBaseboneConstraintType()
        Return the basebone constraint type of this chain.
        Returns:
        The basebone constraint type of this chain.

      • getBaseboneConstraintUV

        public Vec2f getBaseboneConstraintUV()
        Return the basebone constraint unit vector.
        Returns:
        The basebone constraint unit vector of this FabrikChain2D.

      • getBaseLocation

        public Vec2f getBaseLocation()
        Return

        Regardless of how many bones are contained in the chain, the base location is always the start location of the first bone in the chain.

        If there are no bones in the chain when this method is called then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Returns:
        The base location of this FabrikChain2D.

      • getBone

        public FabrikBone2D getBone(int boneNumber)
        Return a bone by its location in the IK chain.

        The base bone is always bone 0, each additional bone increases the number by 1.

        Parameters:
        boneNumber - The number of the bone to return from the Vector of FabrikBone2D objects.
        Returns:
        The FabrikBone2D at the given location in this chain.

      • getBoneConnectionPoint

        public FabrikChain2D.BoneConnectionPoint2D getBoneConnectionPoint()
        Return the bone connection point of this chain. The connection point will be either BoneConnectionPoint2D.START or BoneConnectionPoint2D.END.
        Returns:
        The bone connection point of this chain.

      • getChain

        public List<FabrikBone2D> getChain()
        Return the actual IK chain of this FabrikChain2D object,
        Returns:
        The IK chain of this FabrikChain2D as a List of FabrikBone2D objects.

      • getChainLength

        public float getChainLength()
        Return the current length of this IK chain.

        This method does not dynamically re-calculate the length of the chain - it merely returns the previously calculated chain length, which gets updated each time a bone is added to the chain.

        Returns:
        The length of this IK chain as stored in the mChainLength property.

      • getConnectedBoneNumber

        public int getConnectedBoneNumber()
        Return the number of the bone in another chain that this FabrikChain2D is connected to.
        Returns:
        The connected bone number as stored in the mConnectedBoneNumber property.

      • getConnectedChainNumber

        public int getConnectedChainNumber()
        Return the number of the chain in the structure containing this FabrikChain2D that this chain is connected to.
        Returns:
        The connected chain number as stored in the mConnectedChainNumber property.

      • getEffectorLocation

        public Vec2f getEffectorLocation()
        Return the location of the end effector in the IK chain.

        Regardless of how many bones are contained in the chain, the end effector is always the end location of the final bone in the chain.

        If there are no bones in the chain when this method is called then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Returns:
        Vec2f

      • getLastTargetLocation

        public Vec2f getLastTargetLocation()
        Return the last target location for which we attempted to solve this IK chain.

        The last target location and the current target location may not be the same.

        Returns:
        The last target location that we attempted to solve this chain for.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Return the name of this FabrikChain2D.
        Returns:
        The name of his chain, or null if the name has not been set.
        See Also:
        setName(String), getName()

      • getNumBones

        public int getNumBones()
        Return the number of bones in the IK chain.

        Bones may be added to the chain via the addBone or addConsecutiveBone methods.

        Returns:
        The number of bones in the FabrikChain2D.

      • removeBone

        public void removeBone(int boneNumber)
        Remove a bone from this IK chain.

        Bone numbers start at 0, so if there were 3 bones in a chain they would be at locations 0, 1 and 2.

        This chain's mChainLength property is updated to take into account the new chain length.

        If this chain does not contain a bone at the specified location then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        boneNumber - The zero-indexed bone to remove from this IK chain.
        See Also:
        mChainLength, mBaseLocation

      • setBaseboneConstraintType

        public void setBaseboneConstraintType(FabrikChain2D.BaseboneConstraintType2D type)
        Set the basebone constraint type on this chain.
        Parameters:
        type - The BaseboneConstraintType2D to set.

      • setBaseboneConstraintUV

        public void setBaseboneConstraintUV(Vec2f constraintUV)
        Set the constraint unit vector for the basebone of this chain..

        The bone will be constrained about the clockwise and anticlockwise constraint angles with regard to this direction methods on the FabrikBone2D to be constrained.

        Parameters:
        constraintUV - The direction unit vector to constrain the base bone to.
        See Also:
        setBaseboneConstraintType(BaseboneConstraintType2D), FabrikJoint2D.setClockwiseConstraintDegs(float), FabrikJoint2D.setAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs(float)

      • setBaseLocation

        public void setBaseLocation(Vec2f baseLocation)
        Set the base location of this chain.
        Parameters:
        baseLocation - The location to set the mBaseLocation property.
        See Also:
        mBaseLocation

      • setBoneConnectionPoint

        public void setBoneConnectionPoint(FabrikChain2D.BoneConnectionPoint2D boneConnectionPoint)
        Set the bone connection point of this chain.

        When this chain is connected to another chain, it may either connect to the bone in the other chain at the start (BoneConnectionPoint2D.START) or end (BoneConnectionPoint2D.END) of the bone.

        This property is held per-chain rather than per-bone for efficiency.

        Parameters:
        boneConnectionPoint - The BoneConnectionPoint2D to set on this chain.

      • setChain

        public void setChain(List<FabrikBone2D> chain)
        Set the List%lt;FabrikBone2D%gt; of this FabrikChain2D to the provided list by reference.
        Parameters:
        chain - The List%lt;FabrikBone2D%gt; of FabrikBone2D objects to assign to this chain.
        See Also:
        mChain

      • setColour

        public void setColour(Colour4f colour)
        Set the colour of all bones in this chain to the specified colour.
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour to set on all bones in this chain.

      • setFixedBaseMode

        public void setFixedBaseMode(boolean value)
        Set the fixed base bone mode for this chain.

        If the base bone is 'fixed' in place, then its start location cannot move unless it is attached to another chain (which moves). The bone is still allowed to rotate, with or without constraints.

        Specifying a non-fixed base location while this chain is connected to another chain will result in a RuntimeException being thrown.

        Fixing the base bone's start location in place and constraining to a global absolute direction are mutually exclusive. Disabling fixed base mode while the chain's constraint type is BaseBoneConstraintType2D.GLOBAL_ABSOLUTE will result in a RuntimeException being thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - Whether or not to fix the base bone start location in place.

      • setMaxIterationAttempts

        public void setMaxIterationAttempts(int maxIterations)
        Set the maximum number of attempts that will be made to solve this IK chain.

        The FABRIK algorithm may require more than a single pass in order to solve a given IK chain for an acceptable distance threshold. If we reach this iteration limit then we stop attempting to solve the IK chain.

        Specifying a maxIterations value of less than 1 will result in an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        maxIterations - The maximum number of attempts that will be made to solve this IK chain.

      • setMinIterationChange

        public void setMinIterationChange(float minIterationChange)
        Set the minimum iteration change before we dynamically abort any further attempts to solve this IK chain.

        If the current solve distance changes by less than this amount between solve attempt then we consider the solve process to have stalled and dynamically abort any further attempts to solve the chain to minimise CPU usage.

        If a minIterationChange value of less than zero is provided then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        minIterationChange - The minimum change in solve distance from one iteration to the next.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Set the name of this chain, capped to 100 characters if required.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to set.

      • setSolveDistanceThreshold

        public void setSolveDistanceThreshold(float solveDistance)
        Set the distance threshold within which we consider the IK chain to be solved.

        If a solve distance of less than zero is provided then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        solveDistance - The distance between the end effector of this IK chain and target within which we will accept the solution.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Return a concise, human-readable of the IK chain.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        String

      • updateTarget

        public float updateTarget(float targetX,
                          float targetY)
        Update the target location of this FabrikChain2D and attempt to solve the IK chain for the new target location.

        The end result of running this method is that the IK chain configuration is updated.

        This method simply constructs a Vec2f from the provided arguments and calls the Vec2f version of the updateTarget method. By making this available, the user does not need to use our custom Vec2f class in their application.

        Parameters:
        targetX - (float) The x location of the target.
        targetY - (float) The y location of the target.
        Returns:
        float The resulting distance between the end effector and the new target location after solving the IK chain.

      • updateTarget

        public float updateTarget(Vec2f newTarget)
        Update the target location and solve the IK chain for this target to the best of our ability.

        We will iteratively attempt up to solve the chain up to a maximum of mMaxIterationAttempts. This method may return early if any of the following conditions are met:

        • We've already solved for this target location,
        • We successfully solve for distance, or
        • We grind to a halt (i.e. low iteration change compared to previous solution).
        Parameters:
        newTarget - The target location to solve this IK chain for.
        Returns:
        The distance between the end effector and the target of our best solution
        See Also:
        mMaxIterationAttempts, mSolveDistanceThreshold, mMinIterationChange

      • getBaseboneRelativeConstraintUV

        public Vec2f getBaseboneRelativeConstraintUV()
        Return the relative constraint UV about which this bone connects to a bone in another chain.

      • setBaseboneRelativeConstraintUV

        public void setBaseboneRelativeConstraintUV(Vec2f constraintUV)
        Set the constraint UV about which this bone connects to a bone in another chain.

        This method is used internally by the FabrikStructure2D.updateTarget() method.
